Job Title: Lead Diagnostic Medical Sonographer
Job Summary:
We currently have an amazing opportunity for a Lead Diagnostic Medical Sonographer position with our company Onsite Imaging Services. The Lead Sonographer functions as a healthcare provider who, working under the delegated authority of the supervising physician, serves as a medical imaging professional who provides clinically relevant information to assist the physician with the diagnosis and treatment of patients. The Lead Sonographer role and responsibilities includes the supervision of sonography staff as well as professional development oversight of sonography staff. The Lead Sonographer scope of practice includes those procedures, acts and processes permitted by law, for which the individual has received education and clinical experience, has demonstrated competency, and has completed the appropriate ARDMS certification(s) standard of practice in ultrasound.

For obstetric ultrasound examinations and procedures: Sets up ultrasound and procedure equipment; positions patient appropriately; operates ultrasound with or without physician guidance when appropriate (including but not limited to, amniotic fluid assessment, fetal viability, limited – detailed – and complete obstetric ultrasound, biometry and fetal wellbeing assessments, fetal Doppler studies, fetal echocardiograms, CVS, amniocentesis, first-trimester screening). More than three (3 ) years of experience as a registered sonographer
Familiarization with ultrasound policies, procedures, and protocols

Responsibilities
Produce diagnostic images and hemodynamic testing of the human anatomy utilizing both stationary and portable ultrasound equipment. Record patient images via appropriate archival media, transfer images as needed. Review clinical information regarding patient along with images with the Radiologist.
Achieve images onto appropriate media, follow UCLA Radiology Department’s verification process, and maintain accurate up-to-date records of procedures performed. Maintain departmental quality standards. Explain to fellows, residents, and new employee the methods of scanning and equipment operations when directed. Practice sterile techniques, maintain aseptic conditions and use universal precautions at all times. Perform first aid on patients to maintain patient’s health until further assistance arrives.

Float between all UCLA Health Department of Radiology ultrasound locations. Adhere to on-call, holiday, and weekend schedules as prepared by the manager. Participate in rotating shifts as required.

Ensure Radiology requisitions are properly completed. Initiate proper requests for required maintenance or repair of equipment. Inspect all devices for damage and ensure they are operating within accepted parameters. Maintain accurate record of all supplies used and initiate orders to maintain supply par levels. Maintain work area in a clean and orderly fashion. Comply with Medical Center health and infection control policies. Comply with personnel standards in employee and technologist handbooks. Adhere to departmental attendance and tardiness policies. Comply with sonographers Code of Practice.

Performs diagnostic sonographic imaging through the application of non-ionizing, high-frequency sound-waves for patients of all ages as directed by physicians. Maintains patient safety.

Job Description
Ultrasound technicians, also known as diagnostic medical sonographers, operate machines called sonographic scanners that create images of patients' internal organs. Sonographers can work in physicians' offices, clinics or hospitals, and night and weekend shifts may be required. They may specialize in certain areas, such as breast, obstetric or vascular sonography. An associate's or bachelor's degree is usually required, and individuals who already hold a degree in another area of healthcare often can complete sonography training through a one-year certificate program.
Job Duties
At the beginning of a session, ultrasound technicians usually explain the procedure to the patient as well as program and adjust the scanner for the specific procedure. Unless the sonographer is making a video recording of the ultrasound images, he or she decides which still images, called sonograms, to capture and show to the physician for diagnostic purposes. Although the obstetric and gynecologic ultrasound associated with developing fetuses is the most commonly known procedure in the field, the ultrasound technician may also work as a specialist in neurological (brain), breast, heart or abdominal sonography.

The center currently uses GE equipmentand provides a wide range of diagnostic imaging services to the community in a patient friendly and comfortable environment. As a Sonographer you'll:
Perform a wide range of outpatient ultrasound exams, such as general ultrasound, breast, OB/GYN, vascular, and other ultrasound exams on incoming patients.
Guide patients through this sometimes difficult process by kindly talking them through the steps and answering their questions and concerns regarding exam procedures and process.
Assist radiologists with ultrasound guided biopsies and vascular ultrasound procedures as needed.
Requirements:

We are excited to announce an opportunity in the growing Pulse Heart Institute! The Institute is a partnership between Cardiac Study Center, MultiCare Regional Heart & Vascular Centers and MultiCare Medical Associates. These organizations share a long history of delivering clinically innovative firsts to the region.
Pulse Heart Institute is the first of its kind in our community and combines the best of private practice with the extensive capabilities of a large health system. It is an integrated, cardiovascular organization to unite cardiac, thoracic, and vascular services into one cohesive unit. Pulse works to build a seamless, comprehensive range of care in both adult inpatient and outpatient settings.
Pulse Heart Institute is working to realize the vision of becoming a world-class health care organization and a destination center for cardiac, thoracic, and vascular care. Patients in our community and beyond can experience better outcomes, significantly improved access to care, a refined, patient-centric approach, and advanced state-of-the-art programs.

The ultrasound technologist will use leading edge technology and be willing to learn new best practices relatable to the field.

About us
Southern Medical Corporation was founded in 1987 in response to a shortage of trained technologists able to perform competent cardiovascular services. Now SMC is a leading provider of in-office diagnostic ultrasound services across the southern states including Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas.

About us
Southern Medical Corporation was founded in 1987 in response to a shortage of trained technologists able to perform competent cardiovascular services. Now SMC is a leading provider of in-office diagnostic ultrasound services across the southern states including Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas.

Job Description:
This position may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to $5,000! The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

Perform a wide range of outpatient ultrasound exams, such as general ultrasound, breast, OB/GYN, vascular, and other ultrasound exams on incoming patients.

Assist radiologists with ultrasound guided biopsies and vascular ultrasound procedures as needed.

Job Title: Ultrasound Tech; Day Shift; 1.0FTE - $5K Sign-On Bonus
Job Description:
This position may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to $5,000! The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

Required Qualifications:
EEO/M/F/D/V

Guam Radiology Consultants is the largest and most advanced Diagnostic and Interventional Radiology center in the Western Pacific. We operate during regular clinic hours from: 8AM – 6PM, Monday to Friday and 8AM - 1PM on Saturday. There is no call or weekend work required. You will be supported by a full team of U.S. board certified physicians providing imaging and interventional radiology procedures. We all get along well and strive for an excellent work-life balance. Healthcare providers remain highly respected and appreciated on the island of Guam.
We are looking for a full time registered Ultrasound Technologist to join our team. Known for our warm and hospitable community, Guam is the crown jewel of the Mariana Islands With a robust tourism industry that offers peaceful, white-sanded beaches and fascinating dive sites and outdoor activities. Guam is home to a thriving, diverse local community. We also serve our large Air Force and Navy communities.
We offer a comprehensive and very competitive salary & benefits package to include relocation expenses. Guam is a US Territory. You can easily travel to surrounding countries. With proximity to exotic locales such as Japan, Korea, China, Hong Kong, Taiwan, Australia and the Philippines, Guam is the perfect hub for travel enthusiasts. Reply and let’s discuss this great opportunity.

Job Description
JOB TITLE: REGISTERED VASCULAR SONOGRAPHER
REPORTS TO: TECHNICAL DIRECTOR VASCULAR LAB | Classification: Non-exempt |Status: Full-time | Grade:
POSITION SUMMARY
Performs all the essential function of the Registered Vascular Sonographer. Performs and evaluates sonographic examinations and physiologic vascular testing. Obtains clinical history and performs a physical assessment of the patient’s condition to determine appropriate testing protocol. Provides a technical interpretation of sonographic and physiologic data to aid physicians in rendering a medical diagnosis.

About us
Southern Medical Corporation was founded in 1987 in response to a shortage of trained technologists able to perform competent cardiovascular services. Now SMC is a leading provider of in-office diagnostic ultrasound services across the southern states including Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas.
For over 30 years, Southern Medical Corporation has provided superior diagnostic ultrasound services for private practices and hospitals. There is a strong demand for our clinical services and we are actively recruiting experienced, cardiovascular Sonographers to join our exceptional clinical team. At SMC, you will be a part of a continually growing organization and benefit from an exciting work environment, a clinically diverse work schedule, and a competitive compensation package.

Fast growing, prestigious, well-established OB/GYN medical office in the Northern Suburbs is seeking a Sonographer. Must be able to work independently without supervision and have excellent problem-solving skills. Ensures a high level of quality and service is delivered to all patients.
Performs ultrasound studies in a clinical environment, including abdominal, vaginal, and OB/GYN exams. Have clear understanding of image formation and display. Have a clear understanding of fetal growth and development, as well as the basics of pelvic anatomy. Demonstrate skills and ability to locate normal anatomical and fetal abnormalities. Tech will be able to provide correct fetal measurements and history. The Tech will be responsible for exam set-up, physician assistance, patient care, and operation of department equipment.

Fast growing, prestigious, well-established OB/GYN medical office in the Northern Suburbs is seeking a Sonographer. Must be able to work independently without supervision and have excellent problem-solving skills. Ensures a high level of quality and service is delivered to all patients.

Primary duties:

About us
Southern Medical Corporation was founded in 1987 in response to a shortage of trained technologists able to perform competent cardiovascular services. Now SMC is a leading provider of in-office diagnostic ultrasound services across the southern states including Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas.
For over 30 years, Southern Medical Corporation has provided superior diagnostic ultrasound services for private practices and hospitals. There is a strong demand for our clinical services and we are actively recruiting experienced, cardiovascular Sonographers to join our exceptional clinical team. At SMC, you will be a part of a continually growing organization and benefit from an exciting work environment, a clinically diverse work schedule, and a competitive compensation package.

This role may be eligible for a sign-on bonus!
Summary:

Documents results of tests accurately.

Baptist Health has a commitment to strengthening the compassionate care we provide. With the addition of Boca Raton Regional Hospital, Baptist Health is able to provide the Palm Beach community expanded access to healthcare services.

In 2016 we welcomed the newest weapon in the fight against cancer, the world-class Miami Cancer Institute and proton therapy center.

Baptist Health South Florida is once again one of the 2019 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For! This is the 19th time Baptist Health has been recognized on the list. We have also been recognized for being among the best healthcare providers in the nation by U.S. News & World Reports in its 2019-2020 Best Hospitals report and have been honored as one of PEOPLE's 2019 50 Companies That Care by PEOPLE magazine and Great Place to Work.

Everything we do at Baptist Health, we do to the best of our ability. That includes supporting our team with extensive training programs, millions of dollars in tuition assistance, comprehensive benefits and more. Working within our award-winning culture means getting the respect and support you need to do your best work ever. Find out why this is the best place to be your best!

Job Title: Ultrasound Tech; Day Shift; 1.0FTE - $5K Sign-On Bonus
Job Description:
This position may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to $5,000! The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

EEO/M/F/D/V

Job Title: Ultrasound Tech; Day Shift; 1.0FTE - $5K Sign-On Bonus
Job Description:
This position may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to $5,000! The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

Required Qualifications:
EEO/M/F/D/V

Job Description:
Job Description
NYMI Associates has been providing high quality, state of the art diagnostic imaging services for over forty years.
Located on the Upper East Side of Manhattan, NYMI Associates is a community-based diagnostic radiology practice specializing in the widest range of imaging modalities using state of the art imaging equipment.
Ultrasound Technologist:
NYMI Associates is currently seeking a Full-time (days) technologist. Monday-Friday
Responsibilities:

Purpose: Responsible for the independent operation of sonography equipment, and for performing and communicating results of diagnostic examinations using sonography. Meet and exceed patient expectations and adhere to established practices while assuring the best possible care for patients.
Responsibilities:
Performs clinical assessment and diagnostic sonography examinations.
Performs all requested sonographic examinations as ordered by the attending physician.
Prepares preliminary reports.

Performs diagnostic sonographic examinations utilizing ultrasonic equipment to locate, evaluate and record critical functional, pathological, and anatomical data. Typically reports to a chief technologist or manager.

About us
Southern Medical Corporation was founded in 1987 in response to a shortage of trained technologists able to perform competent cardiovascular services. Now SMC is a leading provider of in-office diagnostic ultrasound services across the southern states including Louisiana, Mississippi, and Texas.
For over 30 years, Southern Medical Corporation has provided superior diagnostic ultrasound services for private practices and hospitals. At SMC, you will be a part of a continually growing organization and benefit from an exciting work environment, a clinically diverse work schedule, and a competitive compensation package.

We are excited to announce an opportunity in the growing Pulse Heart Institute! The Institute is a partnership between Cardiac Study Center, MultiCare Regional Heart & Vascular Centers and MultiCare Medical Associates. These organizations share a long history of delivering clinically innovative firsts to the region.
Pulse Heart Institute is the first of its kind in our community and combines the best of private practice with the extensive capabilities of a large health system. It is an integrated, cardiovascular organization to unite cardiac, thoracic, and vascular services into one cohesive unit. Pulse works to build a seamless, comprehensive range of care in both adult inpatient and outpatient settings.
Pulse Heart Institute is working to realize the vision of becoming a world-class health care organization and a destination center for cardiac, thoracic, and vascular care. Patients in our community and beyond can experience better outcomes, significantly improved access to care, a refined, patient-centric approach, and advanced state-of-the-art programs.

General Summary:
Interventional Cardiology group seek Cardiac Sonographer for busy practice in Kingwood area. We offer a very competitive pay package-benefits include Medical/Dental/Vision/Life, PTO and 401K.

Prepares equipment ensuring that equipment is operational, safe and functioning.

Job Title: Ultrasound Tech; Day Shift; 1.0FTE - $5K Sign-On Bonus
Job Description:
This position may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to $5,000! The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

Required Qualifications:
EEO/M/F/D/V

Explains procedures to patients and/or accompanying family members.
Position patients.
Selects appropriate transducer depending upon depth of field, organ to be identified, etc.
Conducts scanning procedures using Ultrasound equipment.
Moves scanner over specific body area, adjusts equipment to focus.
Uses AS or other imaging software, emr, makes soft copy images as directed and sends them to PACS along with the scanned documents.
Documents results of tests accurately.

OB/GYN ARDMS Sonographer
BORO PARK OB/GYN, the largest Ob/Gyn practice in Brooklyn, NY, is seeking an ARDMS certified ob/gyn ultrasound technician in our Brooklyn office. The candidate we are seeking will join our team of 10 highly experienced technicians who work independently and report to our highly acclaimed 16 physicians and midwives.
Qualifications:
To qualify you must have at least 3 of ob/gyn recent work experience, knowledge of EMR, a High School diploma or equivalent. Only applicants with second trimester ob anatamy scan experience with excellent clinical skills will be considered. Candidates must have RDMS in ob/gyn or be RDMS eligible to be considered.

Fast growing, prestigious, well-established OB/GYN medical office in the Northern Suburbs is seeking a Sonographer. Must be able to work independently without supervision and have excellent problem-solving skills. Ensures a high level of quality and service is delivered to all patients.
Performs ultrasound studies in a clinical environment, including abdominal, vaginal, and OB/GYN exams. Have clear understanding of image formation and display. Have a clear understanding of fetal growth and development, as well as the basics of pelvic anatomy. Demonstrate skills and ability to locate normal anatomical and fetal abnormalities. Tech will be able to provide correct fetal measurements and history. The Tech will be responsible for exam set-up, physician assistance, patient care, and operation of department equipment.
Primary duties:

This role may be eligible for a sign-on bonus!
Summary:
Performs sonography in accordance with applicable scope and standards of practice and with the policies, values, and mission of the organization.
Work Schedule:
Multiple shifts and schedules available across various locations
Responsibilities:
Reviews patient history, physician's orders and does scheduling. Educates patient regarding procedures, equipment and exam to ensure patient's understanding and cooperation. When ordered, prepares and administers contrast media and/or medications within scope of practice.

Seeking an experienced vascular ultrasound technician for a solo vascular surgery office. This is a well established vascular surgery office with reputation. We would like a dedicated tech with RVT who can provide carotid duplex, low and upper extremity arterial and venous studies, ABI/TBI, abdominal duplex for renals,mesenteries, aortoiliac and aneurysm check, venous duplex in legs for insufficiency check etc. Varicose vein studies and prior experience with assisting surgery will be a plus. Position is for either part time or full time. Depending on your work performance, full time as well as benefits can be considered. Must have Covid vaccination proof. Prefers close distance commute. May start pay per study but may promote to hourly pay once proven quality.
Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract
Pay: $35.00 - $50.00 per hour

$1,500 SIGN ON BONUS!

This position performs all ultrasound exams/procedures as ordered by our referring staff. Position is accountable for all peripheral activities associated with each test/procedure e.g. ID patient, educating patient and family members, validating order and ordering physician, completing all paper work, completing all meditech entries, sending images to PACS, scanning of all paperwork, ensure quality patient care and follow up with stat reads when necessary. Able to use vRAD and complete transfer sheet correctly. Ensure preliminary reports are entered into PACS. Maintain Resert log on a daily basis. Keep equipment and rooms neat, clean and fully stocked. Communicate any issues to lead sonographer. Interact cooperatively with ancillary departments.
Qualifications:

If you are caring, someone who likes to do a good job and wants to work for an employer who values these same traits, then CVRMC wants you. The Echo Cardiac and General Sonographer is responsible for performing Echo Cardiac Ultrasound procedures to assist physicians in the diagnosis of disease, injuries or other medical conditions; provides a high degree of compassionate patient care. Additionally, this position will be required to perform general ultrasound procedures. This position will utilize appropriate techniques in performing the best possible ultra sound studies. Will confirm order and diagnosis with medical record/follows-up with attending or hospitalist if necessary. Explains procedures, educates patient, assesses for level of understanding and clarity. Gathers appropriate historical data. Maintains skills and continually upgrades knowledge base. Communicates adequately and appropriately with physicians. Prioritizes patient needs and patient load.
Qualifications:

Performs high quality and comprehensive diagnostic ultrasound imaging exams in accordance with established department guidelines and protocols under the supervision of the MFM physicians
Maintains a high standard of medical ethics at all times and is self-motivated to increase their level of understanding and knowledge of the field, disease processes, and new procedures as they evolve
Prepares examination reports and effectively communicates clinical information and ultrasound technical findings to the interpreting physician
Typical cases include: first trimester screening for chromosomal anomalies, transvaginal assessment of cervical length, routine and comprehensive ultrasound examinations, biophysical profiles, growth assessment, and Doppler assessment of the middle cerebral artery peak velocity, umbilical artery, umbilical vein, and ductus venosus in cases of twin-twin transfusion and fetal growth restriction

Assist radiologists with ultrasound guided biopsies and vascular ultrasound procedures as needed.

We invite you to come join our Liberty Pacific Advanced Imaging West Hills team as an Ultrasound Technologist. This full-time career opportunity has a varied schedule; including weekends and evenings, and is located at our multi-modality outpatient imaging practice in West Hills, CA. The center currently uses GE equipmentand provides a wide range of diagnostic imaging services to the community in a patient friendly and comfortable environment. As a Sonographer you'll:
Perform a wide range of outpatient ultrasound exams, such as general ultrasound, breast, OB/GYN, vascular, and other ultrasound exams on incoming patients.

Performs high quality and comprehensive diagnostic ultrasound imaging exams in accordance with established department guidelines and protocols under the supervision of the MFM physicians

Prepares examination reports and effectively communicates clinical information and ultrasound technical findings to the interpreting physician
Typical cases include: first trimester screening for chromosomal anomalies, transvaginal assessment of cervical length, routine and comprehensive ultrasound examinations, biophysical profiles, growth assessment, and Doppler assessment of the middle cerebral artery peak velocity, umbilical artery, umbilical vein, and ductus venosus in cases of twin-twin transfusion and fetal growth restriction

Overview
Mednax Services, Inc. is a national medical group. Over the last 40 years, through our network of over 3,500 clinicians in 39 states and Puerto Rico, we have reshaped care delivery within women's and children's specialties and subspecialties. Our clinical teams care for the unique population of high-risk pregnancies and critically ill infants and children in both hospital and ambulatory clinical settings. Over the years, clinicians practicing as part of Pediatrix and Obstetrix Medical Groups have used evidence-based tools, continuous quality initiatives, clinical research, and telemedicine to enhance patient experience, outcomes and provide high-quality, cost-effective patient care. Our nationwide team of almost 8,000 employees, including physicians, advanced practitioners, clinical leaders, business and operational experts who work together every day to fulfill our mission to take great care of the patient®. We invite you to join the Mednax family and help shape the future of health care.

The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

We are excited to announce an opportunity in the growing Pulse Heart Institute! Overview
Mednax Services, Inc. is a national medical group. Over the last 40 years, through our network of over 3,500 clinicians in 39 states and Puerto Rico, we have reshaped care delivery within women's and children's specialties and subspecialties. Our clinical teams care for the unique population of high-risk pregnancies and critically ill infants and children in both hospital and ambulatory clinical settings. Over the years, clinicians practicing as part of Pediatrix and Obstetrix Medical Groups have used evidence-based tools, continuous quality initiatives, clinical research, and telemedicine to enhance patient experience, outcomes and provide high-quality, cost-effective patient care. Our nationwide team of almost 8,000 employees, including physicians, advanced practitioners, clinical leaders, business and operational experts who work together every day to fulfill our mission to take great care of the patient®. We invite you to join the Mednax family and help shape the future of health care.

Job Description:
This position may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to $5,000! The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

Required Qualifications:
EEO/M/F/D/V

Performs ultrasound studies in a clinical environment, including abdominal, vaginal, and OB/GYN exams. Have clear understanding of image formation and display. Have a clear understanding of fetal growth and development, as well as the basics of pelvic anatomy. Demonstrate skills and ability to locate normal anatomical and fetal abnormalities. Tech will be able to provide correct fetal measurements and history. The Tech will be responsible for exam set-up, physician assistance, patient care, and operation of department equipment.

Overview
Mednax Services, Inc. is a national medical group. Over the last 40 years, through our network of over 3,500 clinicians in 39 states and Puerto Rico, we have reshaped care delivery within women's and children's specialties and subspecialties. Our clinical teams care for the unique population of high-risk pregnancies and critically ill infants and children in both hospital and ambulatory clinical settings. Over the years, clinicians practicing as part of Pediatrix and Obstetrix Medical Groups have used evidence-based tools, continuous quality initiatives, clinical research, and telemedicine to enhance patient experience, outcomes and provide high-quality, cost-effective patient care. Our nationwide team of almost 8,000 employees, including physicians, advanced practitioners, clinical leaders, business and operational experts who work together every day to fulfill our mission to take great care of the patient®. We invite you to join the Mednax family and help shape the future of health care.

The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer demonstrates advanced knowledge and skills in the performance of OB/GYN and infertility ultrasounds, utilizing various transducers with ultrasound imaging equipment and 3D/Doppler technology. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer takes direction from the physician and the Ultrasound Supervisor as it relates to specific patient care needs or concerns. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer works under the supervision of the Medical Director for all ultrasound procedures. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer reports directly to the Medical Director and should function in an independent fashion.
CCRM is an industry leading pioneer in fertility science, research and advancement, offering access to national network of award-winning physicians, a full suite of fertility services, innovative technology and cutting edge labs. CCRM is currently comprised of eleven locations spanning the U.S. and Canada with growth planned for continued network development on a domestic and international basis.

Overview
Mednax Services, Inc. is a national medical group. Over the last 40 years, through our network of over 3,500 clinicians in 39 states and Puerto Rico, we have reshaped care delivery within women's and children's specialties and subspecialties. Our clinical teams care for the unique population of high-risk pregnancies and critically ill infants and children in both hospital and ambulatory clinical settings. Over the years, clinicians practicing as part of Pediatrix and Obstetrix Medical Groups have used evidence-based tools, continuous quality initiatives, clinical research, and telemedicine to enhance patient experience, outcomes and provide high-quality, cost-effective patient care. Our nationwide team of almost 8,000 employees, including physicians, advanced practitioners, clinical leaders, business and operational experts who work together every day to fulfill our mission to take great care of the patient®. We invite you to join the Mednax family and help shape the future of health care.

The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer is responsible for the independent operation of sonographic equipment, and for performing and communicating results of diagnostic examinations. The Sonographer is expected to have a high level of knowledge in anatomy and pathology, as imaged through sonography. Sonographers must have the ability to work efficiently and independently. During the normal course of duty, the sonographer is expected to work in collaboration with the facility physician and radiologist. It is our goal to provide our clients and their patients with superior diagnostic ultrasound imaging services in a caring, safe, and efficient manner. Must be proficient in General and Vascular Ultrasound. Must have the understanding of needs for excellence in communication, customer service and patient satisfaction. Graduate of an Accredited School of Sonography or Radiologic Technology. Sonographer

The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

Required Qualifications:
EEO/M/F/D/V

We invite you to come join our Liberty Pacific Advanced Imaging West Hills team as an Ultrasound Technologist. This full-time career opportunity has a varied schedule; including weekends and evenings, and is located at our multi-modality outpatient imaging practice in West Hills, CA. The center currently uses GE equipmentand provides a wide range of diagnostic imaging services to the community in a patient friendly and comfortable environment. As a Sonographer you'll:
Perform a wide range of outpatient ultrasound exams, such as general ultrasound, breast, OB/GYN, vascular, and other ultrasound exams on incoming patients.
Guide patients through this sometimes difficult process by kindly talking them through the steps and answering their questions and concerns regarding exam procedures and process.
Assist radiologists with ultrasound guided biopsies and vascular ultrasound procedures as needed.
Requirements:

Seeking a full-time OB/GYN Sonographer who will be responsible for the independent operation of diagnostic medical equipment to expose various OB/GYN conditions, and for performing and communicating results of diagnostic examinations using sonography. Ultrasound examinations include a variety of conditions ranging from routine OB/GYN to fetal anatomy survey, nuchal translucency, biophysical profile, and endovaginal scans.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: Education:
· High School diploma or GED preferred.
·Current certification as a Registered Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Obstetrics and Gynecology (RDMS OB/GYN) Preferred
· American Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonographers (ARDMS) Principles Preferred

Explains procedures to patients and/or accompanying family members.
Position patients.
Selects appropriate transducer depending upon depth of field, organ to be identified, etc.
Conducts scanning procedures using Ultrasound equipment.
Moves scanner over specific body area, adjusts equipment to focus.
Uses AS or other imaging software, emr, makes soft copy images as directed and sends them to PACS along with the scanned documents.
Documents results of tests accurately.

The Perinatal Ultrasound Technologist will carefully screen for prenatal detection and diagnosis of anomalies so the perinatologist can offer final recommendations that potentially improve the outcome of the patient’s pregnancy. In addition to performing accurate, high quality ultrasound exams, the perinatal sonographer must have a firm knowledge of physiology and anatomy relevant to obstetrics. The ultrasound technologist will use leading edge technology and be willing to learn new best practices relatable to the field.
Position Requirements
Certified or eligible for certification by the America Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonographers (ARDMS). All Sonographers must obtain certification within twenty-four months of eligibility or cross training. Certified in CPR or obtain within 90 days of employment. At least 2 years’ experience in obstetrical ultrasound is preferred, but not required.

License/Certification Requirements: Yes

The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer demonstrates advanced knowledge and skills in the performance of OB/GYN and infertility ultrasounds, utilizing various transducers with ultrasound imaging equipment and 3D/Doppler technology. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer takes direction from the physician and the Ultrasound Supervisor as it relates to specific patient care needs or concerns. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer works under the supervision of the Medical Director for all ultrasound procedures. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer reports directly to the Medical Director and should function in an independent fashion.
CCRM is an industry leading pioneer in fertility science, research and advancement, offering access to national network of award-winning physicians, a full suite of fertility services, innovative technology and cutting edge labs. Our company provides 24/7 "on call" services in Colorado areas by region. We are currently looking for techs to cover days, nights and weekend shifts. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer is responsible for the independent operation of sonographic equipment, and for performing and communicating results of diagnostic examinations. The Sonographer is expected to have a high level of knowledge in anatomy and pathology, as imaged through sonography. Sonographers must have the ability to work efficiently and independently. During the normal course of duty, the sonographer is expected to work in collaboration with the facility physician and radiologist. It is our goal to provide our clients and their patients with superior diagnostic ultrasound imaging services in a caring, safe, and efficient manner. Must be proficient in General and Vascular Ultrasound. Must have the understanding of needs for excellence in communication, customer service and patient satisfaction. Graduate of an Accredited School of Sonography or Radiologic Technology. Registered (RDMS) (RVT) or Registry Eligible with 1 years experience as a sonographer in a high volume facility and BLS certification required.

Overview
Mednax Services, Inc. is a national medical group. Over the last 40 years, through our network of over 3,500 clinicians in 39 states and Puerto Rico, we have reshaped care delivery within women's and children's specialties and subspecialties. Our clinical teams care for the unique population of high-risk pregnancies and critically ill infants and children in both hospital and ambulatory clinical settings. Over the years, clinicians practicing as part of Pediatrix and Obstetrix Medical Groups have used evidence-based tools, continuous quality initiatives, clinical research, and telemedicine to enhance patient experience, outcomes and provide high-quality, cost-effective patient care. Our nationwide team of almost 8,000 employees, including physicians, advanced practitioners, clinical leaders, business and operational experts who work together every day to fulfill our mission to take great care of the patient®. We invite you to join the Mednax family and help shape the future of health care.

Prepares examination reports and effectively communicates clinical information and ultrasound technical findings to the interpreting physician

Over the last 40 years, through our network of over 3,500 clinicians in 39 states and Puerto Rico, we have reshaped care delivery within women's and children's specialties and subspecialties. Our clinical teams care for the unique population of high-risk pregnancies and critically ill infants and children in both hospital and ambulatory clinical settings. Over the years, clinicians practicing as part of Pediatrix and Obstetrix Medical Groups have used evidence-based tools, continuous quality initiatives, clinical research, and telemedicine to enhance patient experience, outcomes and provide high-quality, cost-effective patient care. Our nationwide team of almost 8,000 employees, including physicians, advanced practitioners, clinical leaders, business and operational experts who work together every day to fulfill our mission to take great care of the patient®. We invite you to join the Mednax family and help shape the future of health care.

Diagnostic Medical sonographer
Under the direct supervision of the site physician, provides health care services to assist in the diagnosis and treatment of disease. Performs carotid sonogram, thyroid, abdominal sonogram. Submits documentation of findings for the physician's review.
Sonographer
The sonographer conducts sonographic procedures on assigned patients using diagnostic ultrasound equipment. Performs various ultrasound studies including thyroid, abdominal, and limited vascular exams such as carotid studies as requested. Does not supplant the physician in the sphere of decision making required to establish a diagnosis, but will assist in gathering sonographic and other medical data necessary to reach a medical diagnosis and decision.

RARE OPPORTUNITY to work with an amazing team of sonographers and physicians. No holidays, nights, or weekends! Medpro is currently seeking a sonographer that has a passion for OB / Women's health to provide ultrasound services to private OB/Gyne offices located in the northwest Chicago suburban area. Come be part of a team of highly skilled sonographers whose work is highly valued. Must be able to provide high-quality 1st, 2nd, and 3rd trimester OB exams and all aspects of Gynecology ultrasound scanning independently. NT certification a plus but not required. Must be willing to obtain certification after training. Full time or part-time available. Flexible scheduling is available. Enjoy going from office to office on a regular basis- no office politics here! The company is owned and operated by a sonographer.
Medpro Imaging Mobile Services, LLC is a leader in ultrasound staffing in the Chicagoland area. For over a decade, Medpro has provided experienced, registered diagnostic medical sonographers to private physician offices, multi-specialty clinics, and large hospital-based medical groups.

Position Title: Echo / Vascular Technician
Department: Imaging
Wage Range: DOE
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

General Description
Organizes, performs, and records high quality, safe vascular ultrasounds that require ingenuity, initiative and independence judgement, as ordered by physicians. Seeking an experienced vascular ultrasound technician for a solo vascular surgery office. This is a well established vascular surgery office with reputation. We would like a dedicated tech with RVT who can provide carotid duplex, low and upper extremity arterial and venous studies, ABI/TBI, abdominal duplex for renals,mesenteries, aortoiliac and aneurysm check, venous duplex in legs for insufficiency check etc. Varicose vein studies and prior experience with assisting surgery will be a plus. Position is for either part time or full time. Depending on your work performance, full time as well as benefits can be considered. Must have Covid vaccination proof. Prefers close distance commute. May start pay per study but may promote to hourly pay once proven quality.

Pay: $35.00 - $50.00 per hour

Job Title: Ultrasound Tech; Day Shift; 1.0FTE - $5K Sign-On Bonus
Job Description:
This position may be eligible for a sign-on bonus of up to $5,000! The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer performs diagnostic and therapeutic sonographic procedures, while providing hands-on, caring and compassionate patient care. Sonographers provide direct patient care under the direction of a Radiologist, with emphasis on maintaining organizational values and standards of behavior. The technique is operator-dependent, and its optimal performance requires a highly skilled and well-educated individual who can continuously integrate known clinical information, ultrasound image content and related physiologic data to tailor the examination to ensure that it is comprehensive and accurate. Diagnostic Medical Sonographers are required to participate in an on-call rotation based on department needs outside of business hours and must be able to work weekends and holidays.

Required Qualifications:
EEO/M/F/D/V

Job Description
Gago Center for Fertility is looking for a Sonographer to join our team who desires to specialize in the field of reproductive endocrinology and infertility and also assist with medical assistant responsibilities, training provided by the practice.
Benefits include paid time off, 401k, flexible scheduling, and advanced training in the field of reproductive endocrinology and infertility.
Company Name: Gago Center for Fertility / Gago IVF

Job Description:
The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer demonstrates advanced knowledge and skills in the performance of OB/GYN and infertility ultrasounds, utilizing various transducers with ultrasound imaging equipment and 3D/Doppler technology. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer takes direction from the physician and the Ultrasound Supervisor as it relates to specific patient care needs or concerns. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer works under the supervision of the Medical Director for all ultrasound procedures. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer reports directly to the Medical Director and should function in an independent fashion.
CCRM is an industry leading pioneer in fertility science, research and advancement, offering access to national network of award-winning physicians, a full suite of fertility services, innovative technology and cutting edge labs. CCRM is currently comprised of eleven locations spanning the U.S. and Canada with growth planned for continued network development on a domestic and international basis.

Performs high quality and comprehensive diagnostic ultrasound imaging exams in accordance with established department guidelines and protocols under the supervision of the MFM physicians
Maintains a high standard of medical ethics at all times and is self-motivated to increase their level of understanding and knowledge of the field, disease processes, and new procedures as they evolve
Prepares examination reports and effectively communicates clinical information and ultrasound technical findings to the interpreting physician
Typical cases include: first trimester screening for chromosomal anomalies, transvaginal assessment of cervical length, routine and comprehensive ultrasound examinations, biophysical profiles, growth assessment, and Doppler assessment of the middle cerebral artery peak velocity, umbilical artery, umbilical vein, and ductus venosus in cases of twin-twin transfusion and fetal growth restriction

Explains procedures to patients and/or accompanying family members.
Position patients.
Selects appropriate transducer depending upon depth of field, organ to be identified, etc.
Conducts scanning procedures using Ultrasound equipment.
Moves scanner over specific body area, adjusts equipment to focus.
Uses AS or other imaging software, emr, makes soft copy images as directed and sends them to PACS along with the scanned documents.
Documents results of tests accurately.

The Perinatal Ultrasound Technologist will carefully screen for prenatal detection and diagnosis of anomalies so the perinatologist can offer final recommendations that potentially improve the outcome of the patient’s pregnancy. In addition to performing accurate, high quality ultrasound exams, the perinatal sonographer must have a firm knowledge of physiology and anatomy relevant to obstetrics. The ultrasound technologist will use leading edge technology and be willing to learn new best practices relatable to the field.
Position Requirements
Certified or eligible for certification by the America Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonographers (ARDMS). All Sonographers must obtain certification within twenty-four months of eligibility or cross training. Certified in CPR or obtain within 90 days of employment. At least 2 years’ experience in obstetrical ultrasound is preferred, but not required.

License/Certification Requirements: Yes

Our company provides 24/7 "on call" services in Colorado areas by region. We are currently looking for techs to cover days, nights and weekend shifts. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer is responsible for the independent operation of sonographic equipment, and for performing and communicating results of diagnostic examinations. The Sonographer is expected to have a high level of knowledge in anatomy and pathology, as imaged through sonography. Sonographers must have the ability to work efficiently and independently. During the normal course of duty, the sonographer is expected to work in collaboration with the facility physician and radiologist. It is our goal to provide our clients and their patients with superior diagnostic ultrasound imaging services in a caring, safe, and efficient manner. Must be proficient in General and Vascular Ultrasound. Must have the understanding of needs for excellence in communication, customer service and patient satisfaction. Graduate of an Accredited School of Sonography or Radiologic Technology. Registered (RDMS) (RVT) or Registry Eligible with 1 years experience as a sonographer in a high volume facility and BLS certification required.

Job Description:
The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer demonstrates advanced knowledge and skills in the performance of OB/GYN and infertility ultrasounds, utilizing various transducers with ultrasound imaging equipment and 3D/Doppler technology. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer takes direction from the physician and the Ultrasound Supervisor as it relates to specific patient care needs or concerns. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer works under the supervision of the Medical Director for all ultrasound procedures. The Diagnostic Medical Sonographer reports directly to the Medical Director and should function in an independent fashion.
CCRM is an industry leading pioneer in fertility science, research and advancement, offering access to national network of award-winning physicians, a full suite of fertility services, innovative technology and cutting edge labs. CCRM is currently comprised of eleven locations spanning the U.S. and Canada with growth planned for continued network development on a domestic and international basis.

Performs high quality and comprehensive diagnostic ultrasound imaging exams in accordance with established department guidelines and protocols under the supervision of the MFM physicians
Maintains a high standard of medical ethics at all times and is self-motivated to increase their level of understanding and knowledge of the field, disease processes, and new procedures as they evolve
Prepares examination reports and effectively communicates clinical information and ultrasound technical findings to the interpreting physician
Typical cases include: first trimester screening for chromosomal anomalies, transvaginal assessment of cervical length, routine and comprehensive ultrasound examinations, biophysical profiles, growth assessment, and Doppler assessment of the middle cerebral artery peak velocity, umbilical artery, umbilical vein, and ductus venosus in cases of twin-twin transfusion and fetal growth restriction

Explains procedures to patients and/or accompanying family members.
Position patients.
Selects appropriate transducer depending upon depth of field, organ to be identified, etc.
Conducts scanning procedures using Ultrasound equipment.
Moves scanner over specific body area, adjusts equipment to focus.
Uses AS or other imaging software, emr, makes soft copy images as directed and sends them to PACS along with the scanned documents.
Documents results of tests accurately.

The Perinatal Ultrasound Technologist will carefully screen for prenatal detection and diagnosis of anomalies so the perinatologist can offer final recommendations that potentially improve the outcome of the patient’s pregnancy. In addition to performing accurate, high quality ultrasound exams, the perinatal sonographer must have a firm knowledge of physiology and anatomy relevant to obstetrics. The ultrasound technologist will use leading edge technology and be willing to learn new best practices relatable to the field.
Position Requirements
Certified or eligible for certification by the America Registry of Diagnostic Medical Sonographers (ARDMS). All Sonographers must obtain certification within twenty-four months of eligibility or cross training. Certified in CPR or obtain within 90 days of employment. At least 2 years’ experience in obstetrical ultrasound is preferred, but not required.

License/Certification Requirements: Yes

Job Description:
Overview
Mednax Services, Inc. is a national medical group. Over the last 40 years, through our network of over 3,500 clinicians in 39 states and Puerto Rico, we have reshaped care delivery within women's and children's specialties and subspecialties. Our clinical teams care for the unique population of high-risk pregnancies and critically ill infants and children in both hospital and ambulatory clinical settings. Over the years, clinicians practicing as part of Pediatrix and Obstetrix Medical Groups have used evidence-based tools, continuous quality initiatives, clinical research, and telemedicine to enhance patient experience, outcomes and provide high-quality, cost-effective patient care. Our nationwide team of almost 8,000 employees, including physicians, advanced practitioners, clinical leaders, business and operational experts who work together every day to fulfill our mission to take great care of the patient®. We invite you to join the Mednax family and help shape the future of health care.

Diagnostic Medical sonographer
Under the direct supervision of the site physician, provides health care services to assist in the diagnosis and treatment of disease. Performs carotid sonogram, thyroid, abdominal sonogram. Submits documentation of findings for the physician's review.
Sonographer
The sonographer conducts sonographic procedures on assigned patients using diagnostic ultrasound equipment. Performs various ultrasound studies including thyroid, abdominal, and limited vascular exams such as carotid studies as requested. Does not supplant the physician in the sphere of decision making required to establish a diagnosis, but will assist in gathering sonographic and other medical data necessary to reach a medical diagnosis and decision.

RARE OPPORTUNITY to work with an amazing team of sonographers and physicians. No holidays, nights, or weekends! Medpro is currently seeking a sonographer that has a passion for OB / Women's health to provide ultrasound services to private OB/Gyne offices located in the northwest Chicago suburban area. Come be part of a team of highly skilled sonographers whose work is highly valued. Must be able to provide high-quality 1st, 2nd, and 3rd trimester OB exams and all aspects of Gynecology ultrasound scanning independently. NT certification a plus but not required. Must be willing to obtain certification after training. Full time or part-time available. Flexible scheduling is available. Enjoy going from office to office on a regular basis- no office politics here! The company is owned and operated by a sonographer.
Medpro Imaging Mobile Services, LLC is a leader in ultrasound staffing in the Chicagoland area. For over a decade, Medpro has provided experienced, registered diagnostic medical sonographers to private physician offices, multi-specialty clinics, and large hospital-based medical groups.

Position is for either part time or full time. Depending on your work performance, full time as well as benefits can be considered. Must have Covid vaccination proof. Prefers close distance commute. May start pay per study but may promote to hourly pay once proven quality.

Performs various ultrasound studies including thyroid, abdominal, and limited vascular exams such as carotid studies as requested. Does not supplant the physician in the sphere of decision making required to establish a diagnosis, but will assist in gathering sonographic and other medical data necessary to reach a medical diagnosis and decision.

RARE OPPORTUNITY to work with an amazing team of sonographers and physicians. No holidays, nights, or weekends! Medpro is currently seeking a sonographer that has a passion for OB / Women's health to provide ultrasound services to private OB/Gyne offices located in the northwest Chicago suburban area. Come be part of a team of highly skilled sonographers whose work is highly valued. Must be able to provide high-quality 1st, 2nd, and 3rd trimester OB exams and all aspects of Gynecology ultrasound scanning independently. NT certification a plus but not required. Must be willing to obtain certification after training. Full time or part-time available. Flexible scheduling is available. Enjoy going from office to office on a regular basis- no office politics here! The company is owned and operated by a sonographer.
Medpro Imaging Mobile Services, LLC is a leader in ultrasound staffing in the Chicagoland area. For over a decade, Medpro has provided experienced, registered diagnostic medical sonographers to private physician offices, multi-specialty clinics, and large hospital-based medical groups.

Position Title: Echo / Vascular Technician

General Description
Organizes, performs, and records high quality, safe vascular ultrasounds that require ingenuity, initiative and independence judgement, as ordered by physicians. Performs prescribed procedures in accordance with department/facility policies, procedures, and protocols. Ensures optimal care and treatment of the patient population.

Seeking an experienced vascular ultrasound technician for a solo vascular surgery office. This is a well established vascular surgery office with reputation. We would like a dedicated tech with RVT who can provide carotid duplex, low and upper extremity arterial and venous studies, ABI/TBI, abdominal duplex for renals,mesenteries, aortoiliac and aneurysm check, venous duplex in legs for insufficiency check etc. Varicose vein studies and prior experience with assisting surgery will be a plus. Position is for either part time or full time. Depending on your work performance, full time as well as benefits can be considered. Must have Covid vaccination proof. Prefers close distance commute. May start pay per study but may promote to hourly pay once proven quality.

Job Description
NYMI Associates has been providing high quality, state of the art diagnostic imaging services for over forty years.

Ultrasound Technologist:
NYMI Associates is currently seeking a Full-time (days) technologist. Monday-Friday
Responsibilities:

Under the direction of the Director of Imaging Services or designee, performs diagnostic ultrasound and vascular procedures in an outpatient setting for neonates, pediatric, adolescent, adult, and geriatric, at a technical level that does not require constant supervision or technical detail. Performs a variety of technical ultrasound procedures that requires independent judgment, initiative and ingenuity to perform prescribed ultrasound procedures for diagnostic purposes. Assumes responsibility for efficient operation of all ultrasound equipment and maintains the ability to assist in other areas of diagnostic imaging services.

Baptist Health has a commitment to strengthening the compassionate care we provide. With the addition of Boca Raton Regional Hospital, Baptist Health is able to provide the Palm Beach community expanded access to healthcare services.

Boca Raton Regional Hospital is an advanced tertiary medical center with 400 beds and is a recognized leader in Cardiovascular Care, Oncology, Women's Health, Orthopedics, Emergency Medicine and the Neurosciences, all of which offer state-of-the-art diagnostic and imaging capabilities. The Hospital is now a part of Baptist Health South Florida is the region's largest not-for-profit healthcare organization with more than 23,000 employees working across 11 hospital campuses and more than 100 outpatient facilities throughout Miami-Dade, Monroe, Broward, and Palm Beach counties. In 2016 we welcomed the newest weapon in the fight against cancer, the world-class Miami Cancer Institute and proton therapy center.

Baptist Health South Florida is once again one of the 2019 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For! This is the 19th time Baptist Health has been recognized on the list. We have also been recognized for being among the best healthcare providers in the nation by U.S. News & World Reports in its 2019-2020 Best Hospitals report and have been honored as one of PEOPLE's 2019 50 Companies That Care by PEOPLE magazine and Great Place to Work.

Everything we do at Baptist Health, we do to the best of our ability. That includes supporting our team with extensive training programs, millions of dollars in tuition assistance, comprehensive benefits and more.
